title: 106_hr4852
content: The Act is titled the "Federal Courts Budget Protection Act" and includes budget estimates. The "Federal Courts Budget Protection Act" amends Section 605 of title 28, United States Code to require the Director, supervised by the Judicial Conference of the United States, to submit annual budget estimates to Congress before January 25. The estimates cover expenditures for court maintenance, operation, and the judicial survivors annuity fund, with approval required by the Judicial Conference. The "Federal Courts Budget Protection Act" amends Section 605 of title 28, United States Code to require approval of estimates by the Court of International Trade and the United States Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit. Expenditures for real property construction activities related to courthouses and judicial branch spaces must be based on information provided by the Administrator of General Services. General Services must submit prospectuses and cost estimates for future judicial branch construction projects to Congress and the judicial branch. They also need to provide preliminary planning, design, and cost estimates for these projects to the Director. Funds may be appropriated to the judicial branch for construction, acquisition, and repair of Federal courthouses. Funds deposited into the Federal Buildings Fund require approval by relevant committees for projects. The House of Representatives can use funds for necessary expenses related to project development. Estimates must be submitted to Congress and the President for inclusion in the budget without any changes. The Director transmits preliminary expenditure estimates to the President for the unified Federal budget preparation. The Director transmits preliminary and final estimated expenditures and proposed appropriations for the judicial branch to Congress before specific deadlines each year. Periodic examinations of the judicial survivors annuity fund are conducted by an actuary, with findings and recommendations sent to the Judicial Conference. The Director transmits estimated expenditures and appropriations for the judicial branch to Congress annually. The Administrator of General Services is responsible for assessing facility requirements and costs for housing the judicial branch. The planning, design, and construction functions for housing the judicial branch activities are not affected by section 605(a) of title 28, United States Code.
